citation.article-title: Humihabitans oryzae gen. nov., sp. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Humihabitans (Hu.mi.ha′bi.tans. L. masc. n. humus soil; L. part. adj. habitans inhabiting; N.L. part. adj. used as a masc. n. Humihabitans inhabitant of soil).
Gram-positive, catalase-positive, aerobic organisms that form branching hyphae.
Peptidoglycan is of the A type of direct cross-linkage and contains ll-A2pm, glycine, alanine and glutamic acid.
Phylogenetically, the genus is a member of the family Intrasporangiaceae.
The type species is Humihabitans oryzae.
